meanings.definition: A person who manipulates or deceives in order to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: The wangler tricked his friends into giving him extra candy.
meanings.sent2: The wangler at the office always finds a way to get what he wants.
meanings.sent3: The wangler pretended to be sick to skip school, but got caught.
meanings.sent4: She was a wangler in the art of negotiation, always getting the best deals.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the wangler who promises too much but delivers too little.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or deceive in order to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: He tried to wangler his way out of doing his chores.
meanings.sent2: She wanglered her boss into giving her a raise.
meanings.sent3: The cat wanglered the dog into sharing its treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician wanglered the truth to win the election.
meanings.sent5: The magician wanglered the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
